docs.lead_paragraph: The Food and Drug Administration on Thursday approved unrestricted sales of Plan B One-Step, lifting all age limits on the emergency contraceptive.
docs.abstract: Food and Drug Administration approves unrestricted sales of Plan B One-Step, lifting all age limits on the emergency contraceptive; Obama administration had fought lifting age restrictions on so-called morning after pill but gave in after several losses in court.
docs.snippet: The Food and Drug Administration on Thursday approved unrestricted sales of Plan B One-Step, lifting all age limits on the emergency contraceptive.

docs.lead_paragraph: Second-trimester abortions must remain legal because critical information about fetal health is often not available before then.
docs.abstract: Op-Ed article by former Seattle City Council member Judy Nicastro shares her experience of having to abort a fetus in its 23rd week due to health complications; contends second-trimester abortions must remain legal because critical information about fetal health is often not available before then.
docs.snippet: Second-trimester abortions must remain legal because critical information about fetal health is often not available before then.

docs.lead_paragraph: As part of the legislation, lawmakers also agreed to delay a runoff, which will occur if no candidate receives 40 percent of the vote in the primary, by one week.

headline.main: Lawmakers Approve Use of Lever Voting Machines for Fall’s Mayoral Voting
headline.print_headline: Lawmakers Approve Use Of Lever Voting Machines For Fall’s Mayoral Voting

docs.abstract: New York State Legislature votes to allow New York City to redeploy its older lever voting machines for upcoming mayoral primaries, acknowledging that election officials say they cannot count votes cast on electronic machines fast enough to smoothly administer 2013 mayoral election.
docs.snippet: As part of the legislation, lawmakers also agreed to delay a runoff, which will occur if no candidate receives 40 percent of the vote in the primary, by one week.

byline.original: By THOMAS KAPLAN and JESSE McKINLEY

headline.main: Iron Supplements May Reduce Pregnancy Risks
headline.print_headline: Childbirth: A Case for Iron Supplements

docs.abstract: A large review of studies concludes that taking iron supplements during pregnancy reduces the risk for maternal anemia and for having a baby with low birth weight.
docs.snippet: A large review of studies concludes that taking iron supplements during pregnancy reduces the risk for maternal anemia and for having a baby with low birth weight.

docs.lead_paragraph: America is quickly splitting itself into two separate countries, regional enclaves of rigid politics.
docs.snippet: America is quickly splitting itself into two separate countries, regional enclaves of rigid politics.

docs.lead_paragraph: A new health policy that would make condoms available in the district’s high schools is up for a vote on Wednesday night.

headline.main: Board to Vote on Condoms in Boston Schools
headline.print_headline: Board to Vote on Policy to Offer Condoms and Sex Education at High Schools in Boston

docs.abstract: Boston School Committee is set to vote on new health policy that would make condoms available in district's high schools, bringing Boston schools in line with New York and Los Angeles.
docs.snippet: A new health policy that would make condoms available in the district’s high schools is up for a vote on Wednesday night.

docs.lead_paragraph: The legislation would allow terminations in cases when there is a real and substantial risk to the life of the mother, including the threat of suicide, and details the circumstances.

headline.main: Irish Lawmakers Expected to Approve Limited Abortion
headline.print_headline: Irish Lawmakers Expected to Approve Limited Abortion

docs.abstract: Irish Parliament is expected to legalize limited abortion before its summer break after publication of final government proposals that would allow terminations in cases when there is real and substantial risk to life of the mother, including threat of suicide.
docs.snippet: The legislation would allow terminations in cases when there is a real and substantial risk to the life of the mother, including the threat of suicide, and details the circumstances.

docs.lead_paragraph: The House of Representatives approved a bill that would ban abortions after 22 weeks of pregnancy in a largely symbolic vote.

headline.main: In Partisan Vote, House Approves Ban on Abortions After 22 Weeks
headline.print_headline: In Partisan Vote, House Approves Ban on Abortions After 22 Weeks

docs.abstract: House of Representatives approves bill to ban abortions after 22 weeks of pregnancy; largely symbolic vote is most restrictive ban on abortion considered by Congress in past decade, laying bare deep ideological differences between Democrats and Republicans.
docs.snippet: The House of Representatives approved a bill that would ban abortions after 22 weeks of pregnancy in a largely symbolic vote.

docs.lead_paragraph: Forty-one states have enacted abortion restrictions at different stages of pregnancy. The chart below shows at which point after a woman’s last menstrual period that state laws ban abortion.
docs.snippet: Forty-one states have enacted abortion restrictions at different stages of pregnancy. The chart below shows at which point after a woman’s last menstrual period that state laws ban abortion.

docs.lead_paragraph: Instead of focusing on the economy, as an internal party document suggested, House Republicans are pushing the most restrictive abortion bill to come to a vote in a decade.

headline.main: G.O.P. Pushes New Abortion Limits to Appease Vocal Base
headline.print_headline: Unfazed by 2012, G.O.P. Is Seeking Abortion Limits

docs.abstract: Republicans in Washington and state capitals nationwide seem eager to reopen hot-button issue of abortion; House Republicans are pushing most restrictive abortion bill to come to a vote in a decade, and while measure stands no chance of becoming law, advocates on both sides of issue say the chance for states to limit abortion in near future is very real.
docs.snippet: Instead of focusing on the economy, as an internal party document suggested, House Republicans are pushing the most restrictive abortion bill to come to a vote in a decade.
